name: Dark Input Boxes for Dark Themes (Firefox)
description: Make input boxes dark with light text to suit dark themes for firefox.
additional_info:
Designed to complement the Dark Cinnamon theme in Linux Mint 18, but I also use it with firefox on windows using the Dark Carbon theme.

(More than) heavily based on  a version I found at:
http://knusper.net/knusperblog/2014/firefox-gtk-dark-theme-fix/

Modified to also work with Workflow Max without mucking up the submit buttons

This style, as presented here, is intentionally global. If you wish to exclude particular sites you can wrap the code inside the following:

@-moz-document regexp('(?!http://maps\\.six\\.nsw\\.gov\\.au|https://home\\.classdojo\\.com).*'){

/***** STYLE CODE HERE *****\

}

and modify the URLs as required. My example will exclude the following sites:
http://maps.six.gov.au
https://home/classdojo.com

See https://forum.userstyles.org/discussion/31696/exclude-site-from-global-site-style for more about how to do this.
